messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] 9 y.o. boys?
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, Ren!!  Imh expert opinion, that s what I think it boils down to -- that he s looking for what s next.  I became a tad bit too bogged down in getting
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, Ren!! Imh expert opinion, that's what I think it boils down to -- that he's looking for what's next. I became a tad bit too bogged down in getting through the day to day with all parties surviving and avoiding incoming attacks, that I really didn't thoroughly sit down and think until yesterday. Turns out, Christopher was an AVID gamer up until we bought the last game, then he went cold turkey. Done!! I *do* think he's looking for something new, and we'll just keep sticking things in his way until we find something he likes.

I don't mind hunting, searching, et al, but I *do* mind the getting there!! Hopefully this will get easier the further we go along!!

Thanks again!!




Jane Powell
Tribe Commander

"If you bungle raising your children, I don't think anything you do well matters very much." Jackie O

"You must be the change you wish to see in the world." - Gandhi

"The most wasted day is that in which we have not laughed." - Sebastien-Roch Chamfort



---------------------------------
How low will we go? Check out Yahoo! MessengerÂ’s low PC-to-Phone call rates.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: 9 y.o. boys?
messages.msgSnippet: I do believe he s looking for a new direction, but either can t verbalize where he wants to go, or, doesn t know what s out there. Trevor used to get kinda
messages.messageBody:
"I do believe he's looking for a new direction, but either can't
verbalize where he wants to go, or, doesn't know what's out there."

Trevor used to get kinda cranky and irritable when he got restless at
that age, sometimes acted mean towards his family. It was hard to help
him find anything new, because he didn't particularly care for my
ideas usually.:)
He would eventually come up with something on his own, after bouncing
stuff off of me for a while. I was good for ideas, but everything came
from him in the end. He went through some of that restless/angst kinda
behavior from 9-11 roughly and now he's super mellow and interesting
and not a very moody guy at all. He's 16.5.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
